meanings.definition: A single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: She struggled to find the right word to describe the painting.
meanings.sent2: In the English language, a sentence is made up of many words.
meanings.sent3: The word 'book' can mean both a physical object and a verb meaning to make a reservation.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a soothing melody, calming everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The word 'love' carries a powerful emotional weight in our hearts.

meanings.sent1: His word was all she needed to trust him completely.
meanings.sent2: I give you my word that I will finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The word 'tomorrow' can sometimes feel like an empty promise.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a shield, protecting him from any harm.
meanings.sent5: The word 'forever' echoed in his mind, bringing a sense of eternal commitment.
